Comment Text:
Take note that UN don't send army into a country to intervene just because they have civil wars. 

The US however does. But every country that the US intervenes in normally ends up as a war zone like Iraq and Syria - and become a failed state afterwards. The US only intervenes if it is in their national interest to do so i.e. the country has oil that it wants or the country has terror groups that attacked the US like Afghanistan (Al Qaeda). See video 

1.  "The Lust for Libya: How a Nation was Torn Apart | The Big Picture" [https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Sn16bsEHJFY](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Sn16bsEHJFY)
2.  “How the US failed to rebuild Afghanistan” [https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=XKVDXbIpW9Q](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=XKVDXbIpW9Q)

Take note that US itself can also be considered to be a failed state as on 6th Jan 2021 when Congress was certifying Biden as the next president a bunch of extremists instigated by President Trump stormed Capitol Hills to try to stop the proclamation that Biden is the next president. In this attack 5 people died and 140 people were injured. On 20th Jan 2021 25,000 National Guards had to be deployed at Capitol Hill in order to ensure a "peaceful" transfer of power from Trump to President Biden. So, the US has its own internal problems to resolve and will not be able to look at Myanmar's internal problem.

Comment Text:
We currently feels like dying in war is better then staying alive while being suppressed.
It's obvious that war isn't the solution to this. But we are desperate. It's been only a month and the situation is this bad.
If this goes on people would eventually lose the spirit.
The blames on UN are just like a baby crying and being mad at their parents because they don't get what they want, tho this is quite a different situation.
Over 26 people have died today across the country.
We don't know how many will die tomorrow.
We can't sleep well at night. They drop thugs armed with gasoline and ropes, to bring houses and create chaos.

In conclusion, all the stress we've accumulated in those 28 days, are exploding. And we are not satisfied by UN's actions.
Thus UN become a target to blame. But I do believe, UN would be able to bring the military junta to the court.
That's the only hope. 
This is not the words from a professional politician.
I'm just a 19yrs old, normal, unemployed, powerless civilian.

Author: BoBo_HUST

Comment Text:
No military can function without lots of 18 year-olds who think they are bulletproof. Well, they really aren't. Right now, Myanmar has too many of those, so the revolutionary fervour is still strong. Once the blood start flowing then it will recede. Death is irreversible; poverty can be overcome. 

Myanmar generals are some of the most isolated people on Earth. They don't really speak many foreign languages, don't travel or work overseas, and their friends and enemies, dreams and nightmares, are all in Myanmar. Poor Burmese travel and work overseas; the generals don't. So even if they are convicted with crimes, no punishment can be imposed on them; unless, say the US Navy Seal somehow can kidnap them off their base and extradite them; but that's incredibly unlikely.
Author: None

Comment Text:
It's called a proxy war in that case. Most civil wars are proxy wars where great powers give weapons and support to one, both, or more sides. China already gives weapons to the ethnic rebels (Wah State, eg). For example, in Vietnam, the USA sent troops, allies, and weapons to the South while the Soviet Union and China give weapons to the North.

Doesn't matter what it's called. They are very destructive.
